data.title: Saint Jean Chrysostome dans les manuscrits syriaques du Sinaï
data.abstractNote: The Chrysostom scholar is disappointed after reading Agnes Smith Lewis’ Catalogue of the Syriac Mss. (1894). Indeed, the scarcity of Chrysostomic manuscripts is difficult to understand in the case of a Chalcedonian Monastery. However not as rich as in the Syrian Monastery in Wadi El Natrum (a Jacobite Monastery), the Sinaitic collection of Chrysostom’s works is nevertheless significant. This article presents the different texts found in the Sinai and replace them into the type of collection in which they are included, also indicating whether we are dealing with texts extant in Greek or not, authentic or pseudepigraphic.
